Instruction: In a small bowl, mix the garlic, yogurt, and a pinch of salt until well combined.

In a large saucepan or stockpot, combine water, vinegar, and 1 teaspoon of salt; bring to a boil over high heat. Once the water is boiling rapidly, reduce the heat and carefully crack the eggs into the water, ensuring they are well spaced. Cook until the whites are set over the yolks, then promptly remove the eggs with a slotted spoon and place them on a serving dish.
Melt the butter in a small skillet or saucepan. Mix in the paprika. Drizzle the yogurt sauce over the eggs and finish with the paprika butter. Your cilbir is ready!
